backend/main.mo: Defines actor with audit logging types, user and controller role structures, graph node/edge models, and state maps integrating access control.
feature_evidence.json: Lists feature evidence entries mapping features to affected frontend files, components, tests, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries describing the purpose and behavior of various frontend components and hooks.
frontend/index.css: Sets Tailwind base styles and OKLCH color variables for light/dark themes with global layout and border rules.
frontend/index.html: Basic HTML wrapper loading the React app root and main.tsx entry script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app handling authentication, role-based access, profile setup, and dashboard view switching with theming.
frontend/src/components/AccessDeniedScre: Displays login prompt or access‑denied guidance with principal copy support and embedded ICP connection panels.
frontend/src/components/AuditLogDetailDi: Renders a dialog showing detailed audit log information, including timestamps, severity, action type, and descriptions. Provides formatted metadata and UI components for viewing event details.
Displays authentication status, principal ID, and backend connectivity state. Includes UI indicators, copy-to-clipboard support, and error alerts.
frontend/src/components/BroadcastConfigP: Allows configuring external broadcasting of security events by toggling enablement and setting an endpoint URL. Loads existing settings and saves updates through backend mutations.
Provides a file-based code editor with category switching, unsaved-change prompts, and apply/reset functionality. Loads and persists file state via utility functions.
frontend/src/components/DashboardViewSwi: Renders buttons to switch between allowed dashboard views such as security and ICP operations. Highlights the selected view and disables switching if not permitted.
Shows Caffeine platform deployment instructions and provides a link to deploy. Includes informational alerts and outlines required preparation steps.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Displays a simple footer with attribution and a link to caffeine.ai. Uses a heart icon and minimal styling.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Header component handling authentication, theme switching, role-based titles, and optional dashboard view switching.
frontend/src/components/IcpConnectionPan: Panel showing ICP network, canister ID, and connection status with health checks and retry support.
frontend/src/components/IcpControllerMan: UI for listing, granting, and revoking ICP controller roles with validation and confirmation dialogs.
frontend/src/components/IcpControlsCatal: Searchable, category-based catalog for viewing, modifying, importing, and exporting ICP control settings.
Renders a single ICP control row with input widgets based on its type.
frontend/src/components/IcpControlsPanel: Wrapper panel introducing and linking to the ICP controls catalog.
frontend/src/components/IcpMainnetDeploy: UI panel explaining prerequisites and step‑by‑step instructions for deploying canisters to the ICP mainnet. Provides warnings, links, and structured guidance for advanced deployment workflows.
frontend/src/components/NetworkMapCanvas: Canvas component that renders an interactive network graph with panning, zooming, theming, and draggable nodes. Handles drawing nodes, edges, auto-centering, and mouse interaction events.
frontend/src/components/NetworkMapInspec: Inspector panel for viewing and editing a selected network node’s properties and connected edges. Supports updating nodes, creating/deleting edges, and read‑only mode.
Top-level panel that loads, displays, and manages the interactive network map including node creation, deletion, selection, and graph syncing. Integrates canvas rendering, inspector UI, and user-owned node tracking.
frontend/src/components/ProfileSetupModa: Modal dialog prompting a new user to enter and save their display name. Submits profile data using a mutation and prevents closing until completion.
frontend/src/components/RealTimeAlertPan: Displays real-time security alerts and flagged users using recent audit logs. Shows critical/warning events from the last five minutes with live status indicators.
frontend/src/components/RolesAccessPanel: Displays authenticated user principal, app controller principal, and allows claiming controller role with loading and error states.
frontend/src/components/RootTerminalPane: Implements an admin command terminal with command execution, history tracking, and role-based command access checks.
frontend/src/components/SecuritySummaryP: Computes recent security statistics from audit logs and displays alerts and metrics for critical events and failed logins.
frontend/src/components/SuperuserAuditPa: Allows superusers to export audit logs, flagged users, and record related audit events with success/error handling.
frontend/src/components/TestActionsPanel: Form interface for creating test audit entries with configurable action types, severity, and metadata.
frontend/src/components/UserManagementPa: Provides UI to flag, unflag, and remove users by principal ID, displaying and managing a table of flagged users.
frontend/src/components/WebControlQuickT: Offers client‑side ICP control utilities including copying principal IDs, importing/exporting config, resetting settings, and refreshing the session.
frontend/src/components/WorldWideWebCont: Allows granting and revoking World Wide Web Controller roles, validating principal IDs and listing existing controllers.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and manages an authenticated or anonymous backend actor, reinitializing and invalidating queries when identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useBackendHealthCheck: Runs a lightweight backend connectivity check using the actor and exposes connection status and retry behavior.
frontend/src/hooks/useDashboardView.ts: Manages dashboard view selection with session persistence and access‑based view restrictions.
frontend/src/hooks/useIcpControls.ts: Handles ICP controls configuration with URL/session precedence, validation, and setters for network, canister ID, and control values.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and provider for Internet Identity, handling AuthClient initialization, login flow, stored identity restoration, and status tracking.
frontend/src/hooks/useMyNodes.ts: Tracks user-associated node IDs in sessionStorage keyed by principal and exposes functions to add, remove, clear, and reconcile tracked nodes.
frontend/src/hooks/useNetworkGraph.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching and mutating network graph nodes and edges using an actor, with error handling and toast notifications.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Implements various React Query hooks to fetch and mutate user profiles, controller statuses, and security roles via the backend actor.
frontend/src/icp-controls/bindings.ts: Provides helper functions to retrieve control definitions, parse/serialize control values, validate inputs, and generate storage keys.
frontend/src/icp-controls/registry.ts: Declares categories and a large registry of ICP control definitions including metadata, types, options, and defaults.
frontend/src/icp-controls/types.ts: Defines TypeScript types for control categories, control definitions, and category metadata used by the ICP controls registry.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines Tailwind base layers, color variables for light/dark themes, and component styling overrides including z-index fixes and network canvas styles.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider, then renders App.
frontend/src/pages/AdminDashboard.tsx: Renders the admin dashboard with security, audit, terminal, deployment, and management panels using audit logs.
frontend/src/pages/IcpOpsDashboard.tsx: Displays ICP operations dashboard with role-based terminal selection, status panels, network map, and web control tools.
frontend/src/queryKeys.ts: Exports helper functions that generate consistent React Query keys for status, controllers, and network data.
frontend/src/terminal/commandRegistry.ts: Exports the full terminal command registry composed of coreCommands.
frontend/src/terminal/coreCommands.ts: Implements core terminal commands including help, clear, and security role operations with audit logging and query invalidation.
frontend/src/terminal/icpControllerComma: Defines a restricted command set for ICP Controller users, including help, clear, and profile management commands with backend auth checks.
frontend/src/terminal/terminalGuards.ts: Provides helpers for audit logging, error classification, timestamp formatting, and parsing audit enum values.
frontend/src/terminal/types.ts: Defines interfaces for terminal commands, execution context, command output, and history entries.
frontend/src/terminal/webControlAudit.ts: Wraps command execution with best‑effort audit recording and consistent error handling.
frontend/src/terminal/webControlCommandC: Generates metadata for hundreds of safe diagnostic and operational terminal commands.
frontend/src/terminal/worldWideWebContro: Defines core terminal commands like help and clear and registers Web Controller audit‑wrapped commands.
frontend/src/types/networkGraph.ts: Declares types for network graph nodes, edges, and input structures for creating or updating them.
frontend/src/utils/codeEditorStorage.ts: Manages per‑file editor state in localStorage, including loading, saving, diffing, and resetting content.
frontend/src/utils/icpControls.ts: Provides helpers for detecting ICP network defaults, validating canister IDs, and resolving network labels/hosts.
frontend/src/utils/icpControlsImportExpo: Implements JSON import/export, download, and validation utilities for ICP Controls configuration.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Provides helpers to read URL and hash params, persist them in sessionStorage, and clear them from the hash.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS config extending colors, animations, and container settings with plugins for typography, container queries, and animation.
project_state.json: Defines the project's current state, planned architecture, issues, and existing features for managing roles, ICP integration, and admin tools.
